conclusion: To find the power dissipated in the resistor R.
The EMF generated is given by E = B * L * v.
B is the magnetic field strength, L is the length of the conductor rod, v is the velocity of the rod.
The total resistance in the circuit is R_total = R + r.
The current I in the circuit is I = E / R_total = (B * L * v) / (R + r).
The power dissipated in resistor R is P_R = I^2 * R = ((B * L * v) / (R + r))^2 * R.
The power dissipated in the resistor R is P_R = ((B * L * v) / (R + r))^2 * R.
This formula gives the power dissipated in the resistor R as a function of B, L, v, R, and r.
